title: Zed got an item-based buff, but...
body:
This is actually good.

Everyone here will likely shoot me for saying that, but this is the best thing that could happen to Zed balance-wise right now. Why?

**Because now this argument no longer exists to justify his laning phase**: "Buy Mercurial and Zed's useless."

In other words, this is one less anchor for the balance team to have to deal with when trying to figure out how to fix Zed, so his normal ability numbers can be hit without having to worry about him being utterly worthless come mid- to late-game.

replies.body: I talked about this a bit in at least one other thread, but yes, this is basically the idea here. What is difficult about this is that there is the question of just how much effect this has on the overall balance state of the champion (or others in a similar situation, really), and at what levels of play.
So what are the plans for Zed, Trundle and the like? Do you guys already have changes in mind for them to compensate for this substantial indirect buff? Or will you leave them just as they are now.

The current plan is to see the impact of the change and adjust on a champion by champion basis as necessary. It's not out of the question for that to change between now and the patch lock, however, as these things are in flux until that point.

One thing we are currently looking at is an adjustment to GA to give players a bit more options against Zed. Likely more on that soon.

Wrong? No.

Have you ever actually followed PBE?

Even the most "_extremely tentative_" changes are shipped live UNCHANGED in 90% of cases, get slight tweaks in the other 5%, are pulled out and put back the next PBE cycle in 4% and get scrapped in 1%.

Wouldn't buffing GA in order to counter Zed sort of defeat the purpose of removing a hard counter that affects him? A lot of complaints here come from players feeling like they have no real option against Zed but to rush a counter item (e.g. Zhonya's / QSS / GA) while trying to interact as little as possible with him until then. With the changes to QSS improving his late-game viability, it might be better to instead focus on reducing some of his safety during the laning phase, which looks like the main source of frustration against him right now.

Isn't that just going in circles?!?

I guess, in case of Zed, if you just ship the QSS/MS changes to live without preemptive nerfs on him, the only result would be a nearly 100% banrate on him. I don't think that would be a worthful result to be observed. I think you can't get enough in-game information on him due to such high banrate. That just confirms you should nerf Zed with the QSS/MS change.

It is hard to say GA will do much vs Zed. Normally, an assassin oriented champion would find GA to be an issue, at least until they can get enough CDs and damage much later on in the match. Unfortunately, Zed's ult could very literally do no damage and he would still be ridiculously strong. That says a lot. Heck, take out his Q/E damage against champions, keep for minions, and keep his mobility from ult/W and he would STILL be very strong since even his auto-attack dueling capability is comparable to most built ADCs. Let us not forget all the other things he has going for him. Zed has some very real balance problems and it is genuinely amazing he is in the state he is after all this time. It shouldn't take the QSS/Mercurial change to get this point across.

Trundle doesn't need anything since he should be using his on tanks. And fiora already has mountain loads of counterplay to it. Other debuff champs are simple to get around too, only zed might turn into a major issue.
And yet the "Buy Zhonyas and he's useless" argument won't remain?

Because Zhonyas doesn't completely nullify his all-in.  2 scenarios here:

1.  Zed ults you, you immediately trigger Zhonyas, nullifying his ult debuff; however, he's still directly in your face, probably with a full energy bar.
2. Zed ults you, he does his combo, then you wait to trigger Zhonyas so it overlaps with the mark detonation; assuming you're still alive at this point.

Balancing him to be more dependent on his ult when killing a high-priority target will likely tone down his lane bullying and overall midgame dominance when it's down.

1. Is a pretty odd thing to say since that's exactly what Merc Scim does now. 

2. is perfectly replicable with Merc Scim as well - ADCs can wait to remove the debuff until he has done his combo just as easily as mages can wait to Zhonyas.
Zhonyas is a far more calculated risk though, since it leaves you possibly stranded in the same location for the next 2-3 seconds.  QSS/merc is more click-n-go.

Both have benefits. A properly timed Zhonyas used slightly into Zed's combo leaves him with a very small window to use shadows for damage/escape even if it could leave you stranded. 

Zhonyas certainly isn't any less of a counter to Zed than Mercs is.

QSS isn't the same as Zhonya's at all, actually. Zhonya's only stops it if it's timed right, QSS removes it completely. Zhonya's is also going to have a 2 minute cooldown. They can't up QSS cooldown in order to make it stop Zed's ult, as that would severely weaken it's actual purpose. The removal of Crowd Control.

Zhonya's is designed to keep you in place and immortal for 2.5 seconds. QSS is designed to remove crowd control so you can get the eff out, or in. They're actually completely opposite items.

As a Zed player, I definitely prefer seeing Zhonya's to QSS. QSS means my ult is straight up gone for no cost to the person using it. Zhonya's means I can bait them into staying in place for 2.5 seconds giving my jungler time to come in. Zhonya's means there's 2.5 seconds in teamfights they aren't doing what they should be. QSS does not. So on and so forth.

So no, Zhonya's is not as good of a counter as QSS. Especially once they up the cooldown on it to be 33% higher.

Well Zhonyas doesn't remove the debuff. You can mess it up and it happens often. Plus Zhonyas covers basically everything from damage to cc to existence to exams and jobs, etc. That's more or less the difference.

Same case with GA. It covers death as a whole, not just a Zed ult, so it's not exactly a hard counter in that sense.
This is a massive late game buff to him in competitive play. Previously everyone would just buy a QSS and zed would be worthless.

That is the point, yes.

Buffing him like this means removing very hard and accessible counterplay that could stonewall Zed in-game. Removing this counterplay means that there is no longer any concern about Zed becoming a liability later and so his early-game is actually lined up to be addressed.

once you ARE back of course, perhaps you can turn the fight or your team stalled or didn't need you, but it's just unfun to have no control over the situation simply because you HAD to build something that only SOMETIMES counters Zed, or you die.
Well I can deal with him quite easily without using hourglass until really late. His ult doesn't mean a lot if he can't get the damage out for deathmark to hurt that much.

my point is that it's an unfun situation, there's no player control over how to deal with this other than "wait it out" you can't outplay Zed's assured damage without use of an item (or sometimes a spell if you were lucky to get someone who has such a thing to save you)  and using that item is detrimental to your state UNLESS you end up in a situation where you dodge something else; deathmark isn't Zed's entire kit, his passive and multi-Q damage work wonders, and his E in a teamfight is rather useful as well. ( Also, as a note on this point, I do like how hourglass' active works in a trade off manner, but it stands out that it has a trade off while the likes of hexdrinker does, which is basically what zed uses to counter mage bursts, it's simply a situation where one item is just clearly better than the other for countering the other person in a way that gives you the most benifit)

besides, most Zeds won't ult someone with hourglass, and ADCs don't build hourglass so this change to scimitar is going to have some... issues.
